Entry.Name: SLOTH - MD5 Signature TLS 1.3
Entry.Description: Due to the support for RSA-MD5 certificate signature, TLS 1.2 (or TLS 1.3 with legacy algorithms) is prone to a series of transcript collision attacks. If a client uses the same certificate to authenticate with different servers, an attacker can force the victim to create a signature that can be used to impersonate it.

Mitigation.Textual: Do not use Legacy Algorithms with TLS 1.3
